an3.94:0.3: The following demonstrates that stream-entry can take place before jhāna. Other Suttas would even support the position that this is not only possible, but is also the norm. For example, [AN 4.163](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an4.163) calls the jhānas, the “pleasant practice”, and [AN 4.162](https://suttas.hillsidehermitage.org/?q=an4.162) states that this is available for those who don’t have strong tendencies for the three defilements, and it is only the _sakadāgāmi_ who is said to have significantly weakened passion, aversion, and muddledness.
